snippet: A silver-rich mountain — seen by many Bolivians as a potent national symbol — is caving in after centuries of mining, but many of the men who work on the mountain do not want to move.
abstract: Potosi Journal; Bolivia's historic Cerro Rico mountain is caving in from the top down due to centuries of silver mining, threatening national symbol; UNESCO has warned that risk of collapse is critical, but many miners are refusing to move because of unappealing alternatives.
lead_paragraph: A silver-rich mountain — seen by many Bolivians as a potent national symbol — is caving in after centuries of mining, but many of the men who work on the mountain do not want to move.

headline.main: For Miners, Increasing Risk on a Mountain at the Heart of Bolivia’s Identity
headline.print_headline: For Miners, Increasing Risk on a Mountain at the Heart of Bolivia’s Identity

keywords.value: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization
keywords.name: organizations
